meanings.definition: A mass of absorbent material inserted into the body cavity for medical or hygienic purposes.
meanings.sent1: She always carries a tampon in her bag for emergencies.
meanings.sent2: The nurse inserted a tampon to stop the bleeding.
meanings.sent3: When the tampon fell out of her bag, it rolled across the floor.
meanings.sent4: His words acted like a tampon, absorbing all the attention in the room.
meanings.sent5: The tampon expanded as it absorbed the liquid, showing its effectiveness.

meanings.definition: A plug of cotton or other absorbent material inserted into a wound or body cavity to stop a flow of blood or to absorb secretions.
meanings.sent1: After the surgery, the doctor placed a tampon on the wound.
meanings.sent2: She used a tampon to absorb the excess fluid from the wound.
meanings.sent3: The tampon in the wound made it look like a tiny pillow.
meanings.sent4: His silence was like a tampon, soaking up all the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The tampon quickly soaked up the blood, preventing any further bleeding.
